website_summaries.verdict: Single camera setup that's reasonably priced because it doesn't require a separate base station.
pros: Great video quality at full HD resolution
Single camera provides a 130° view and good performance level
Includes night vision, an important feature for a security camera
Includes 2-way audio, so you can speak to someone who's near the camera
cons: Only 1 camera included, which may not meet your security needs

website_summaries.verdict: If you want a simple, straightforward indoor home security camera with top-of-the-line DIY specs and free cloud storage, Netgear's new Arlo Q is a safe bet.
pros: The Netgear Arlo Q is responsive and reliable, with a 1080p HD resolution, motion and sound alerts, two-way talk, night vision, activity zones and free 7-day event-based cloud storage (you can pay a monthly fee for continuous recording, as needed)
cons: Netgear is behind the curve in terms of third-party integrations -- it doesn't currently have any -- and you can't log into the same account on more than one device at the same time
Both the Web and mobile apps could use a design update and the camera itself doesn't feel especially durable compared to its main competition, Nest Cam

customer_reviews.title: Good system, already caught somebody
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Easy setup. Good picture quality. Two way communication works, with slight delay. In general the Arlo camera system has worked very well for me. I've already caught someone trying to brake into my car. The key is the alert/notification system. There's no point to watching a recording the next day of someone taking your stuff. The Arlo motion sensors alert me to activity and then I can deal with it as its happening. The wireless system allows me to move the cameras easily to different locations
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Reina

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design:  Sync Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Common Problem with this Camera, and what I experienced: Will not sync with router. It won't sync, even though same brand (Netgear). Found out it is common issue that Netgear has not been able to solve yet. All their suggestions failed to resolve, including complete reset of router, and no security. The Netgear forums show that this camera commonly fails in the first few months of use with the same issue as I experienced. All of a sudden, it can't connect to router while all other devices and other wireless cameras have no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Laggy, no choice about 2f auth
customer_reviews.text: In addition to huge lag (because it doesn't send the stream directly to your devices, but sends it to their servers then back to your phone), it now FORCES two factor authentication by the end of the year. Wish I hadn't wasted my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Boser

customer_reviews.title: Geofencing does not work
customer_reviews.text: Geofencing on this does NOT work, so you have to manually arm and disarm every time you leave the house. I have contacted customer support and they admitted they have bugs around this they haven't fixed yet. They tried all the troubleshooting workarounds and nothing worked. I just bought this and after not being able to resolve my problem, I asked if I could return the camera to them for a refund (owned 30 days). They said they "don't take refunds", so they get one star as I'm stuck with a non-working camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: Total Disapointment
customer_reviews.text: I have three Cloud Cams. All installed without a problem and work consistently. Basic security camera technology must be common to all security cameras. It is the installation, setup and control applications that provide ease of use or inability to be used. The Arlo applications are very difficult to use and offer little control over the installation or update processes. I tried an iPhone, a Samsung tablet and a Samsung phone. The Arlo camera never became operational. Considering the time within our office that was spent trying to get the Arlo camera operational, it must be the most expensive security camera ever.
customer_reviews.author: oldAvn

customer_reviews.title: 1080p... not even close
customer_reviews.text: In theory these have 1080p resolution, but a 480i tv is as sharp. I don't know if it's the sensor, the lens, or Netgear downgrading the signal for bandwidth, but something doesn't work right. I've got full 5ghz or 2.4ghz signal to all my cams and good reliable internet service. If you want to view the cams live, the wait time is long to super long. Delay between real-life and the video feed, once going, is at least 9 seconds. The 2-way speaker is not loud at all. Trying to get my kids attention is pretty much a lost cause between the volume and the delay, it's just not practical.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Frequent reboots needed
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to restart (unplug/plug in) the Arlo Q Plus frequently (daily) as it will regularly lock-up and not allow you to view live stream via the app or web, lose audio, or worse - simply stop recording. This issue is noted numerous times on the company's product support forum as well. For an expensive (albeit consumer focused) security camera I expected much more, and this is obviously not what you want to go through for this product category. I am hopeful Netgear releases a firmware update that addresses these issues. Their Arlo Pro 2 is considerably more reliable. In its current release it is pretty much a joke as far as reliability unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: ChiWks

customer_reviews.title: Good with one issue...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I like this camera but one annoying issue... There are gaps in recording. For instance I have a clip of my dog walker coming in to get my pup, but no clip of her leaving. Sometimes the motion sensor kicks in and other times, nothing... Picture quality, the app, camera build all good. But the motion detection is annoying. Not sure if I'll keep it. Oh, one other thing. Please note the SD card is ONLY for backup. You need to use cloud storage to use the camera. Would be nice to have an option to use SD card only and still he able to access recorded clips.
customer_reviews.author: Zed

customer_reviews.title: Bad Mobile App, Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: Horrible audio! It works over my Macbook, but not my iPhone, so it's the mobile app and not the cameras. I have spent several hours troubleshooting this. There are several complaints about this with Arlo and it appears to be related to the latest operating system update with the iPhone. I had a NEST camera for five years and NEVER had an issue with my mobile app due to an update. I switched to Arlo because of the cloud back up, but it isn't worth it if one of the camera functions can't be used because of a crappy mobile app. It's time to pack these up and send them back to Amazon and go back to NEST.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Close range 0-25 feet pretty good view when zooming in, quality quickly diminishes afterwards. Good night vision range about 15-20 feet. Audio good, I don't communicate through it, so no review on speaker. Connecting is relatively simple, but let the camera take it's time and don't rush it, it could take a few minutes. No ability to choose what network to connect too. I have three separate networks here and it's connecting to one I don't want it to and there is no way to put it on the network I want it to be on. Menu software could be better. Put all the options in one place instead of three.
customer_reviews.author: Nim

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Q makes a random clicking sound and then sends audio alert
customer_reviews.text: i have several Arlo Q cameras and they make a random clicking sound that sends needless audio alerts. Can't operate the camera in an audio alert mode as I get four or five spurious audio alerts a day. Net Gear says nothing about this common problem. Net Gear never responds to any user threads complaining about this problem. There is no independent user group to discuss Arlo problems. There is an "Arlo Community Bulletin Board" to ask questions, yet I think it is a form of yellow journalism to keep discussions under Net Gear's control. Too expensive a purchase to have to throw the camera away when it seemingly malfunctions.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sarf

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended at all.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible customer service. No phone number, only email. Takes forever to get any response. Even when they do, they don't back up their products. The video is the worst. It has good quality, but you can't play back, and live stream is even worse. If i actually need to see anything on these videos, forget it, i can't see a thing. I have three of these cameras and purchase the higher package for recording and all that, and it sticks to put it lightly. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different brand
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about two years now. Avoid. There always seems to be a problem with connecting to view the video or other issues. For the price you pay for this, it is simply unacceptable. I wish I had never wasted my money on this and went with a different company. Save your money and buy a different companies product.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: When the chips are down, arlo crumbles.
customer_reviews.text: "Arlo is unavailable right now. Please try again later." Well, I am across town with a solid cell signal to my provider and arlo needs a restart or a reboot or a re-sign in but is stuck or too busy or confused? About the fifth time I got this rude message, I was ready to rip the thing off the wall and stomp it to pieces. After I got home. When it works it's fine. But twenty percent of the time when I need to re-arm it and I am not sitting right under it, forget it. If a product that claims to offer safety and security cannot deliver, it is another big lie so do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Cameras often break and Arlo customer support does everything to ignore the issue
customer_reviews.text: These cameras quite often develop a pink tint. From what I've read it is the IR filter sticking. The Arlo website is set up to make it difficult to attain help, but even when I did manage to make it through to someone, they only suggested disconnecting the camera and reconnecting. They refused to help further until I tried this step. It was a nightmare to get the camera added back into the system, but of course it didn't fix the issue. At that point, EVERY call and email has pretty much just been ignored. It seems that Arlo just wants to delay the issue until the warranty expires. This is the LAST Arlo OR Netgear item I EVER purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wherry

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have one Arlo Q and two Arlo Pro 2 cameras. It's been 11 months, and the headaches do not stop. Once again the Arlo Q has disconnected from my Wifi for no known reason, and trying to add it is proving to be futile. I've done this 4 or 5 times since the initial set up so I know eventually it will connect, but I am tired (and pissed off) of playing this game. In a month or two I will be fighting this piece of crap again.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Disabling the app and forcing download of new buggy app - just plain AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do NOT purchase a product from this company. They have pulled the rug out from under their own customers with the app that is required to operate the device by renaming the original app as "legacy," discontinuing that version altogether, and forcing users to download a new version of the app. The app was always buggy anyway, and the new one is somehow even worse. Would never recommend someone reward such awful customer treatment by giving this company any more money at all.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Fluitt

customer_reviews.title: Blurry night vision and a horrible trigger that captured everything late
customer_reviews.text: Failed when I needed it most during a home invasion in which I was home at the time. Captured 3 seconds of the intruder and cut off. Arlo technical support refused to hand over log files without supena, probably due to a flaw in their hardware. This was connected via POE. Blurry night vision and a horrible trigger that captured everything late. Terrible engineering and terrible customer support. Never again Netgear u fell off the map. Don't trust ur life with this product.
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: It just works, yay for me!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of online research. My must haves: some cloud storage WITHOUT any subscription fee, good picture quality, good night vision, sound and motion detection, automatic video saved when triggered, live feed to my phone, shared feed with my wife, not stupid expensive, indoor use. This camera checks every single box, for just $150. I downloaded the app, plugged the camera in, pressed one button to setup the camera and bang, it started working. It is now protecting my garage. Awesome sauce. Buying another for the house.
customer_reviews.author: Greenspace

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Arlo Q because I wanted an alternative to the battery powered Arlo Cameras I already have. I like this camera. It records sound as well as video, which is a big upgrade from the battery cameras. It also seems more sensitive which is great. The only drawback is I wish this model had the micro sd card so I could record continuously. I know the QPlus has it, but I wasn't willing to spend the extra $, this was already pricey considering the alternatives out there now. I decided to stay with Arlo because I already have the battery powered system and didn't want to have to use separate apps.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bayes

customer_reviews.title: Arlo app and motion detection are abysmal
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for a little over a year now and I've had more frustrations from its software and motion detection than anything else. It'll pick up the tiniest fly on its audio mic but won't notice a person literally walking in from the front door into your living room. The app is ridiculously slow and takes upwards of 10 minutes to connect to see what's even going on, and this is with multiple new and current phones being tested. For the amount of money you spend on these things, you'd expect a level of basic functioning but this barely gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Be ware you cannot trigger the Arlo alarm with it, it has not been integrated,
customer_reviews.text: So this thing is set up with the Arlo app, but there is no way to connect it to the Arlo base, nor there is a way to trigger the alarm. If you want a camera that can connect to Arlo you need to buy the normal camera + long cable + base. The help forum comment is 'working on expanding features"? Also, the Arlo cannot schedule alarms over midnight? WTF? I cannot believe a product manager in Netgear accepted these. I am returning this crap now, probably replacing the whole system with a cheaper Chines alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Ale

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: I have arlo cameras this product is a scam literally never working I think people should gather together and sue them they selling a product that doesn't work and asking a lot of money for it. Customer service are a waist of time the don't know anything and obviously can't solve any issue they just hope that you'll just disappear after you spend so much money on the product and it's even worse because their customer service is in India and the people that work there barley know English.
customer_reviews.author: yaniv zinger

customer_reviews.title: Unable to connect using wifi
customer_reviews.text: I tried every method to connect. Have installed dozens of different security cameras both indoors and out, wifi and direct. Never able to use. Unfortunately, waited to install and beyond return period. Seems like really good camera and paid a lot for it, now have expensive paperweight dummy camera. Thanks, sarcasm, NetGear for reading the reviews and offering no support or providing suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: ME n Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable on notification
customer_reviews.text: Has a nice interface compared to the replacement brand I got after finding out how unreliable the Arlo was. Connecting to activate/deactivate was often iffy/difficult. Worse, I found out that I could walk in and it often never notified me or the delay was extremely long. I bought a different brand and have them both hooked up - the other notifies me immediately every single time where the Arlo just isn't connecting to be able to notify. I've waited a long time to review this thinking maybe an update would improve it, but just hasn't. Instead it has gotten worse. 2 stars because an item like this reliability has to be the most important feature.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Seamster

customer_reviews.title: Not so Good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to use with Smarthings. It constantly disconnects from Smarthings and I have to reset the camera. I have the motion detection setup and it is very good most of the time, but every morning it keeps going off. Customer service just tells me to contact Samsung so they are useless. I understand that Smarthings may be where the problem exists, but if you are going to sell a camera that is certified by Samsung to work with Smarthings you need to be able to support. The quality is good and so is the App. Too bad the reliability and the customer service is missing.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: great security cameras
customer_reviews.text: we picked these cameras because at the time, the wireless cameras werent rechargeable, and we are happy with these. we dont really need wireless cameras right now, so these fill our needs perfectly. because they're wired, they're always on and i dont need to worry about changing the batteries. also, the quality is wonderful. the night vision is hit or miss- sometimes it can get whited out a bit if tehre is a lot of light, but i would imagine that's true for any night vision. for what we paid, we are very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Two Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent camera
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is to be expected for an indoor/outdoor camera. No matter the proximity to the router, your wifi may or may not connect at any time. This makes monitoring your toddler in their bedroom difficult. We always have a back up baby monitor available because we can not rely on the arlo’s internet connection. No matter how I select the motion detection area, it never seems to activate when my child moves or even leaves the WHOLE ROOM! And, there’s atleast a 15 second delay on the picture and reality. My kid can be standing next to me already while I still watch him on the camera in bed. Not the perfect baby monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Tee Rachal

customer_reviews.title: NOT built to last
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Arlo devices for years. I like the relatively easy set up and integration of cameras. But 3 years in and I have had 2 Q model cameras fail completely. Another 2 with repeated connectivity issues. Network drops are frequent and they often stubbornly require you go through the complete system set up over and over. Very frustrating. I have found the little Arlo Pro to be the most reliable but it requires its own hub and batteries must be replaced regularly. I’m afraid I will have to find another system.
customer_reviews.author: Krusty

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry, but this camera was absolutely terrible. Once I got it connected, it kept disconnecting and I had to end up resetting it about 10 times to get it working again. It’s just a terrible product and would not recommend! I sent back for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Started out living this camera, but in less than ...
customer_reviews.text: Started out living this camera, but in less than a month I noticed the audio voice function stopped working !!! A major feature of this product is being able to two-converse and go figure it doesn’t work. I noted a few comments from other users that it could be an iOS issue. I will try and troubleshoot but this is no bueno given it’s only been 1 month and this thing isn’t cheap!!! Think twice before toy buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna D

customer_reviews.title: System is OK, Support is JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect to get anything other than crickets when trying to contact them. I regret investing in this system but with 6 cameras and a base station, it's hard to walk away. For what I consider to be a costly product, there should be some sort of support but you basically get funneled into holes but you're never actually able to reach someone.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: A Wonderful Investment
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Arlo Q Plus so much I bought another! This little camera is fantastic for apartment dwellers as well as home owners, and could even be used in a hotel room for added sense of security. We got it so we could see what our dog was doing when we weren't at home and so we could talk to her - it works great for that! Position these cameras where the action will come from the side rather than head on for best detection of movement/sound and quick recording. The revolving 7 day storage in the cloud is quite adequate. Get the recommended memory card so you won't ever lose what videos your camera catches.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Difficult product set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while ago and after a about dozen attempts finally got the camera to sync via the QR code. Today something suspicious happened in front t my house and I went to watch the footage only to find out my camera hasn’t worked for at least 14 days. I’ve just spent the last 15 minutes trying to resync the camera to my WiFi network to no avail. I own two of these cameras and neither went through the sync process well. I would advise buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: JB5722

customer_reviews.title: Terrible terrible and therefore useless
customer_reviews.text: These are are an absolute disaster. The software is so useless. The geo conferencing only works at times. So I get home and the camera software does not recognize that I am home or when I away for that matter. Keeps sending motion Alerts when I am home. The software makes the good hardware useless. So I have manually disarm and arm 3 cameras individually each time I come or leave the house. !! And even when I disarm at times they will not disarm. !! What a junk. Do NOT buy these. I will update if anything changes. But soooooooo dissatisfied for now.
customer_reviews.author: Reza Izadi

customer_reviews.title: On my third replacement camera
customer_reviews.text: First issue was the camera wouldn't stay enabled, second RMA was because the night vision just flashed from white to black. I am not on my third camera in less than a year. I would not recommend this camera if you need reliability. Updated I am now on my fourth replacement camera, and the customer service is just getting worse and worse. Honestly at this point I just want a refund. Each camera received has had different issues, one was a black screen, another has constant clicking noises, another kept shutting off, and the last now randomly flashes images of the past.... I would not wish these cameras on my worst enemy, probably also why their stock is tanking.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Sept 30th 2019 update not working
customer_reviews.text: I downloaded the new app. None of my devices showed up. I attempted to add new devices and it could not find the device. When I went back to the old app it found it just fine. Tomorrow is the last day for the old app. Suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Died within 5 months
customer_reviews.text: It was flaky for a few months but serviceable.... now it won't connect to any wifi network so it's pretty much a paper weight. I do IT for a living so I'm not a newbie. I've gone through multiple machinations of factory resets, router resets, etc. etc. - I was annoyed when I had to do this a few times per month initially - but today - which is 5 months in - it just simply refuses to connect at all. So, I assume I got a dud? The warranty is only 90 days, so I guess I should have complained when I saw the thing acting a little wonky early on. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Banas

customer_reviews.title: Great camera super easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using IP cameras for over a decade and when the Arlo Q was recommended to me I didn't believe its ease and functionality would live up to the promise. It does and then some. I now have five cameras, all of which I can connect to view or configure in seconds on my iPhone or iPad. With GeoFencing, the cameras arm and disarm themselves depending on whether I leave or enter my home 'zone". After all these years hassling with Port Forwarding, etc. I still can't believe how easy these cameras are to set up and use and how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Chiponline

customer_reviews.title: ARLO Q
customer_reviews.text: This is an indoor camera, but I use it for outdoor use from inside the house. I get a great pictures and movies, but I don't use the night vision because it would reflect off the window. I get a decent picture however at night, dark, I can see movement. In the day time, it is great, alerting me of all motion without the use of batteries, just A.C.
customer_reviews.author: Dee R

customer_reviews.title: Arlo still uses Flash
customer_reviews.text: Good software, trusted source, modern interfaces..... but still using Flash?!?! After years of Chrome default blocking Flash content and the constant news that Flash is EOL, Arlo still hasn't updated to HTML5 or similar. There isn't a browser I can use to enable Live Mode anymore. Even back then it was annoying each and everytime having to log in, enable flash, ignore prompts for flash updates, yada yada yada. Just let flash go Arlo.
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: Quick set up
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues with things on my patio moving around with partying neighbors. I also wanted to make sure if anything were to happen indoors, I’d have recording. Super easy set up, night mode is wonderful, the integrity of the picture doesn’t change with day or night. The 20 second recordings that I can view and delete are super helpful if I’m not able to see the movement while it’s happening. Being a nurse I don’t have a totally set schedule I’m also able to see what mischief my dogs are getting into while I’m at work. Will definitely be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This Camera loses connection to the internet regularly and needs to be reset. Have reached out to Arlo and they said that’s just how it works. We have it hard wired via ethernet cable. Camera does what it says it should but like one a week it just stops working until its powered off and then back on. Very unreliable if you want it as a security camera.
customer_reviews.author: James Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: horrible company to deal with
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 Arlo cameras (2 Arlo Q, 3 Arlo pro) and the solar charging pad. Cameras are great when working but about a month after purchasing 2 Arlo Q cameras one stopped working and I called support who did trouble shooting over the phone and found the camera to be defective. They said a new camera would be sent out, 2 weeks later I received nothing and called them and they said that they would need to charge me $16+ to ship out a new camera (seems ridiculous considering how recently I had purchased it) Furthermore my solar panel is not charging the outside camera, I am just disappointed with Arlo given the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Anna

customer_reviews.title: Problematic
customer_reviews.text: My overall rating doesn't jive with the specific questions, does it. Questions should include "Product support?" One star. Or maybe "Recurring problems?" One star. Device consistently stops saving recordings to library. I can temporarily get the device to work for 2-5 days, then I have to reset the device from scratch. Tech support can't provide a permanent fix. Okay, first world problem. I get it. But when Arlo and Netgear say a product works, it should work.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Kiefer

customer_reviews.title: Just OK, app doesn't like Pixel 2 phone
customer_reviews.text: It's fine but more expensive than many other brands that actually do more for less money. The app is simple enough, though it doesn't seem to like my Pixel 2 smartphone (app freezes, lags). But I've had issues with other camera apps (Amcrest) on this phone as well. Bottom line, this is a basic camera, doesn't tilt, pan or zoom remotely, but the picture is fine, audio is fine but the user-end microphone function is spotty. Might be better off with another product, though I think generally these wifi cameras are still a work in progress as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: No good for security
customer_reviews.text: The Q is no good for security for someone away from the house it is installed in. If power or WiFi is interrupted, the camera is powered off and the only way to bring it back online, is to physically be at the camera to sync it. This defeats the use of the camera for security while on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: KTS

customer_reviews.title: Another security camera, another dud
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't set the camera up on my Android phone (unknown ssid), needed to use an old tablet I had. After setup, multiple issues connecting to the camera. Camera is in line of sight and in same room as the wifi router. App is slow. Push-to-talk doesn't work. Glancing at the Arlo support forums, seems they break something with every app release, or when they don't, Google breaks one of the APIs they are using with one of their OS updates. I'm now 0 for 3 (the other two are versions of the Oco) in finding an IP security camera that just works.
customer_reviews.author: SineLanguage

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support computer monitoring anymore
customer_reviews.text: Late last year, after a forced software upgrade, my arlo would not any longer on my home computer; or any computer for that matter. It kept on telling me to install the latest "Adobe Flash Play, even though I had the latest AFP installed already. When I called Arlo help desk, I got the run around. Very disappointing. So now when my relative and co-workers ask about video security camera, I recommend Nest. Will not saddle anyone else with this worthless piece of sh&$(.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to our Arlo System
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try this camera out because mainly for the phase detection and the ability to specify zones to monitor vs the regular Arlo cameras. The 1080 and the audio features are nice additions as well. It doesn’t actually add to your system’s base station, but to your account so it acts almost as a separate device. One question that pops up is if it works well in the window. It does to a point. The part that doesn’t work well is the night vision as the IR reflects onto the glass pane in front of it. Turning it off solves this but again you lose the night vision. The low light is somewhat decent.
customer_reviews.author: J-Chord

customer_reviews.title: it's in the garbage now. It takes forever to connect for a ...
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of use filled with frustration, it's in the garbage now. It takes forever to connect for a live view or to change modes – when it actually works. The majority of the time it is stuck "offline" despite working the previous day or even 20 minutes before. Once stuck in offline, it doesn't ever work unless you hard reset it. After multiple attempts resetting, updating firmware, etc.. I gave up. Reliability is just outright awful. Save your money and find another option.
customer_reviews.author: snooze

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while then could not reconnect
customer_reviews.text: When it works it works great but when it stops working don’t expected it to ever work again! Had the camera and other equipment for about 8 months then everything started going down hill. The Q camera and other products just stopped working (sensing/recording) one at a time. Nothing changed in my network. I have a lot of tech gadgets that use the wifi and everything else still works just fine. Spent many wasted hours trying to reconnect. Just like other reviewers stated it WILL NOT reconnect through the app.
customer_reviews.author: Kim O

customer_reviews.title: Quits after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: 1 yr 2 months later, one camera will no longer connect to wifi no matter how many times I try to reconnect or reset it or power it down. ARLO support was no help. 2 months after warranty to return it 1 camera quit connecting. I can not recommend ARLO cameras. Many people have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: allen

customer_reviews.title: good for its purpose
customer_reviews.text: It has worked good for its purpose especially the motion detection part and notifications. I just wish there was more features like an API that I could tap into and bypass the cloud for latency. But the cloud does have its perks e.g. not being able to tamper with video if it was locally kept. I'm still concerned about accessibility. I don't know if their code is privately audited or not I suspect it isn't. I wish it was open source.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't  last
customer_reviews.text: Bought February dead by October. Great when it was working now wont even power on. This as update for my dead Arlo Q. After a couple of months of back and forth chatting with Arlo CSRs I got an RMA and was able to exchange the defective unit for a working one. Hopefully this on lasts for more than 8 months. Upgraded from 1 star to 3 stars. Getting an RMA shouldn't be like pulling teeth.
customer_reviews.author: theothernewguy

customer_reviews.title: Good camera kind of spendy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to add to my existing Arlo security system. This camera has function very well so far easy to set up and updated fast out of the box Picture quality is equal to the other Arlo cameras I own. Only disappointment is the microphone the audio is good but when you want to speak through the camera the sound is very quite. For that one reason is why I gave it 4 stars not 5. I enjoy the camera and I like the fact it is WiFi and still has a power cord So no battery needed.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not thrilled with this camera. Night vision is terrible and underperforms no matter where it is placed, the audio is barely audible and the field of vision smaller than my previous camera. It sends a constant notification that can be paused only for up to 24 hours. Daytime vision is crisp and good and I like the free cloud service but I would never purchase this camera again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: reader412

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.text: Arlo recently made an update that only allows you view continuous live stream for 30 minutes before it times out. This makes the camera completely and utterly useless when you are monitoring something important, such as children playing outside. Would not recommend to anyone. Ever. There are much better systems out there. I wish I would have known they were going to do this before I purchased. Avoid this system at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: thelizinator

customer_reviews.title: Almost there!.
customer_reviews.text: The camera works great and the picture quality is fantastic, the price point is also very good compared to similar cameras with similar features. I have tried many home security cameras and the only thing that the nest can do better is mobile app functionality. It displays the CVR footage very smoothly as you fast forward or rewind through it. While the arlo is slow and can't even download specific clips from within the app. A huge shortcoming!.
customer_reviews.author: Hector C

customer_reviews.title: Times out every 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very easy to set up and use and has a great quality picture. However, I will say that if you are using this to keep an eye on your kid like on your computer from work, you will have to keep going back into it every 30 minutes as it automatically times out. I have not found a way to change this setting, and from research online it looks like there is no way to change that setting on this model.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. GRAHAM

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Q completes your home security
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 Arlo pro I am using on the outside of my house. And they work great. I have had them for a couple of years now with no problems. So I bought a Arlo Q for the inside of the house. It works great also. Now I have the security inside and outside I wanted. The only thing I would improve on the Arlo q is the setup documentation you get with it. It was little hard to understand. But outside of that the Arlo Q is great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Warner

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera .. until you have to re setup !
customer_reviews.text: I love my Arlo cameras! They work great when they are NEW (easy to setup) .. but fast forward a year later (NEW Netgear Router) .. and they WILL NOT connect ! I have reset everything .. uninstalled app .. re-installed They WILL NOT connect !@ (already 3+ hours into frustration) and of course .. support has run out ! Complete FAIL on re-setups .. brutal Netgear !
customer_reviews.author: Strongman

customer_reviews.title: Works good until it Does'nt
customer_reviews.text: I use Arlo Q to watch my winter house while gone for 5 months at my summer home. Worked great for 1 year. Then I could not access it. Kept getting message "must install newest version of Adobe Flash - install HERE ". I clicked and installed newest version. Arlo still did not work. Got in touch with tech support. 100% useless. First had trouble understanding the person even though it was through "chat" and not voice. Several follow up messages, still 100% useless. If you want a toy buy Arlo. If you seriously want security don't buy Arlo. I have been unable to access video security at my winter house for 1 month now.
customer_reviews.author: C. McGovern

customer_reviews.title: nice camera - bought another one
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera, looks professional, takes quality pictures. I would have rated it 5 stars if the software was a little more robust. The software is a little confusing - eg where/how to get into settings and what some of the settings even mean. I integrated the camera into my ADT Smartthings HUB and it connected fine but the interface offers little benefit - probably a Smartthings issue rather than an ARLO issue. But since the ARLO is the only camera brand supported by Smartthings thought you should know. Overall, if a had a need for a 3rd camera I would buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product. But no 2-way authentication
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed 3/18/2019 PROS: 1080p Camera or at least the video is excellent 7 Days free cloud saves Motion detection Geofencing Magnetic mount CONS: No 2-way authentication for logging in. This is seriously a big security issue. It is a deal breaker. I still hope they will add 2-way auth in the future thats why I did not return it. I trusted this company for my routers and modems. So I know they focused on security. That is why I trust them for my cloud storage. But please 2-way auth should be basic cmon!
customer_reviews.author: Acesnick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several cameras before finding the Arlo Q. I am not tech savvy, so that factor is important. More important is the performance. This camera is OUTSTANDING! A small (5 by 1 inch) under counter light fell from its Velcro and I got a noise alert and even saw the light fall. It was at least 20 feet from the camera. Amazing! Some painters got on my condo deck via a power lift. The camera alerted me to that noise! So far, tech support has been very good. I am keeping this camera. UPDATE: After almost one month of use, my rating of this camera remains OUTSTANDING!
customer_reviews.author: Karl Priest

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: I keep some material on a different location than my house, where I already have 2 Arlo Pro. I have been looking for a way to keep this other location under control, and this new camera has brilliantly solved the problem, I just installed a small hotspot with a basic data service and I was good to go. I like that it doesn't need a "base" and that it also has a mike and speakers, in case I need (...hope not, but you never know). And, it registered immediately under my account, so I can check all the cameras (my house and the separate location) from the normal app. Pretty neat!
customer_reviews.author: Miriano Ravazzolo

customer_reviews.title: Arlo q and arlo
customer_reviews.text: I love these cameras I’ve had the original arlo system for 2 years decided this year to get and add on camera and a arlo q I’ve used them for security and to just check in on my husband when I’m at work he is disabled and it gives me piece of mind when I’m not home. The arlo q is great to be able to talk to him and my animals when we are both gone. So far they have stood up to the outside elements snow rain 100+ degree heat and -20 winters. They have been worth it. I also recommend getting the tenergy brand rechargeable batteries if you have an original system.
customer_reviews.author: carolinaflower

customer_reviews.title: Video recording or playback doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 cameras. Was happy initially but in the last month or so the cameras only record about 20 seconds before video freezes, not the amount of time selected in the "video mode" e.g., 300 seconds. Some video clips don't playback at all. Chatted with someone at ARLO and they said this was a known issue and didn't know when they will have a fix. This is a major problem IMO since this type of bug should not have made it to production for a "security" device or fixed immediately if it did.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Good home security camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: The good: Clear view, prompt alerts, good night vision. The bad: At night there was an object obstructing part of my camera’s view. I could barely seem anything because the object near the camera was very bright and everything else was dim. I wish I had a way to override the brightness settings manually. Other than that issue, night vision is good.
customer_reviews.author: A Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like Arlo cameras - especially because of the no-fee cloud storage. The only drawback that I've found on the Arlo Q is that, in my set-up, I also have several Arlo Pro 2 cameras. And in this configuration, the Q and the Pros do not share the same management (armed/disarmed/geofence). Not a big deal, but if you frequently toggle between different settings, this doubles the work. Overall, I'm very satisfied with the Q, though, and set-up was easy!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great but animals set it off
customer_reviews.text: My husband is overseas and we bought this camera so he can see the dog and talk to her. We love it. The picture is pretty clear and the two way audio is great. I will say the motion detection is ridiculous. Even in the least sensitive setting it records every time my dog yawns on the couch. I’ve tried setting motion zones etc but no matter what it just records every little thing. So we got a continuous recording subscription for $10 a month from them and we don’t even watch the little recorded events anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jill W.

customer_reviews.title: good but not great
customer_reviews.text: great quality and blends very well into the walls. The SmartThings integration works great as well. Where this fails is the restart time. If the power goes out, it takes about 5 minutes to get back to running. Sometimes it's out of focus. Arlo as a whole is nice to keep your weekly recordings for free BUT it does not record while you watch LIVE. Ring Cameras has this feature and it's nice to have that backup footage.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Elder Care Relief
customer_reviews.text: When my father was sent home from hospice; I was very concerned as to how to be there when he needs me without being in his room 24/7. Arlo has allowed me to monitor him while getting some work done -- and some rest. I managed to get the audio notifications so that I don't get notifications for his tv; but do when he calls out for me. My only concern is the phone app doesn't seem to always work. - and thus push notifications aren't sent. When the app isn't working, I am too anxious to rest or work and need to view and listen to what is going on via the live stream..
customer_reviews.author: Bentley S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Arlo Q is a quality netcam with a ton of features. Honestly, I can't stand the idea of paying a monthly cloud storage fee like almost all of the competitors require, so that was the main factor for buying the Arlo over the other options. Since it's free, I can't argue. And yes, it's actually free (cloud storage for 7 days I think). It works as well as I'd expect for the price. Now I've gotta figure out how, and if it's possible, to get my wife as an admin on the app too.
customer_reviews.author: Conspicuous Consumption

customer_reviews.title: Still no basic Alexa voice command integration, after at least a year of waiting!
customer_reviews.text: My Q Pro (POE) is fantastic on its own, and I have no issues with the device itself, but it's been over a year now and there's STILL no basic Alexa integration. YOU CANNOT ARM/DISARM VIA VOICE COMMANDS WITH ALEXA. This apparently goes for any type of Arlo camera, based on the Arlo Alexa skill reviews. This feature should come STANDARD, yet Netgear clearly doesn't want Echo users as their customers. Next time I get a camera it won't be from Netgear, it'll be from a brand that supports modern technology and customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Second thought, would have gone with Nest
customer_reviews.text: I *did* read the reviews and for reasons, I can't remember now, thought this was a superior product. I was unaware that I would have to pay to have video recording on all the time, so I have to remember when workers/sitters, etc will be in the house so I can manually start recording (which is a bit wonky - as it doesn't always work). PROS: Great video clarity Great microphone CONS: Expensive!!! Horrible speaker Tends to not be able to connect at the precise time you want to start recording Doesn't integrate as well as others (e.g. Nest)
customer_reviews.author: Laura C.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. I only docked a star because I ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I only docked a star because I had some trouble getting my cameras to be recognized by the Arlo app. The fix, when I eventually found it was simple: Reset to factory setting. Why I had to do this on four perfectly good and unused camera, I don't know. So, besides a small hassle with setup, I highly recommend these cameras!Also, the tech service is outstanding. No waiting for tech support when I called on a Saturday afternoon and they were able to solve the issue quickly and patiently walked me through all the steps and waited until I successfully completed my installation. A+
customer_reviews.author: M. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera For Future Angela Martins of the World
customer_reviews.text: I picked up two Arlo outside cameras and love knowing who’s coming and going around my house. I recently adopted a cat and was nervous about her terrorizing the house when I went to work. I set the Arlo Q up inside and I can get alerted whenever there is movement downstairs. I like that there is a speaker too. That way I can totally go all crazy cat lady with talking to my cat when I’m away. If anyone is striving to be the next Angela Martin, this camera is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Das Em

customer_reviews.title: Camera failure too common
customer_reviews.text: One of the campers in my two pack was dead on arrival. Following a request for a replacement, the cameras were easy enough to set up. I did not like all the ads that pop up in the software for other Arlo products, and after about 3 years of use, one camera has completely failed. The support team was not motivated in the least help resolve the issue. Between my experience with a high failure rate and lack of meaningful customer support, I am defiantly done with Arlo for good. Too many quality option out there to risk replacing these every 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use once it is connected to network
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this camera to monitor the Air Purifier ON light in the attic when the furnace fan comes on. This way I can be alerted sooner rather than later if the purifier fails. The prior purifier failed during the first year and the way to tell it is not working is that when the furnace fan is ON the Purifier light should be ON. I didnt discover the failure until we had our winter service call on the HVAC. Setup was a bit kludgy but once connected to my network setting up the camera is easy.
customer_reviews.author: jgh

customer_reviews.title: Gives Us Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly father who lives with us that is prone to falls. There are a few hours between when we leave for work and when the care giver gets there. The motion sensor is wonderful because I can just check the app on my phone to make sure he hasn't fallen. Sometimes he drops his phone or accidentally turns it on silent mode, so the 2 way audio is perfect in this situation. The night vision is great if we need to check on him in the middle of the night. I am very happy with my purchase. The package arrived on time, as promised. I would definitely recommend the Arlo Q.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend a lot of money, but wanted a camera I could check on while I was away. This seems to fit the bill so far. It has very good resolution, and picks up most of the motion and audio. I like the infra red feature. I would like to add another one, and possibly some outdoors. The only drawback is that the wifi disconnects at times, although it reconnects. I'm still getting used to it after only a week of use, but I think this purchase was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Reader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up - Many viewing devices supported
customer_reviews.text: This camera and included free storage is just what I was looking for. I am really thrilled that there is an Arlo App for Kindle Fire HD also. If only my new security system cam came with one! I also have the app on my older Android smartphone and it is quick to come up. [as well as Web view from browser] Full control from either connection. Great piece of mind even when I'm home, because I am on acreage, home alone 9-10 hours a day and like to know what's happening outside before I go out, or while I am out of site upstairs and back of house. I plan to buy another one for a rear view.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kool

customer_reviews.title: Keep the nice box it comes in for returning it
customer_reviews.text: Find a different camera. The motion sensor at lowest will pick up random ants crawling 500 yards away. The picture quality is sub-standard, especially for the price. I gave it two stars, the packaging was nicer than the junk inside and it does work with Samsung smart things. Actually it just lost a star as you have to also PAY for online storage. Check into hikvision or Amcrest unless it's for Samsung smart things compatibility
customer_reviews.author: Lance10

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Parent Cam
customer_reviews.text: We use this to help our elderly parents and it gives us excellent view into the home when needed. The software works as expected allowing us to speak to them or watch them when they need remote help.
customer_reviews.author: Beany from Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Great cameras for the money but one stopped working at 11 months
customer_reviews.text: Cameras worked great for approximately 11 months. Suddenly one camera wouldn't connect and the other one suddenly stopped recording even when there is motion and sound. I tried downloading the new app, resetting the camera, but nothing works. I tried the support section on the Arlo website (Netgear no longer owns Arlo) but it said there was a charge for calling tech support. I tried the live chat and it said it wasn't available.
customer_reviews.author: Linds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device
customer_reviews.text: The function of this thing is remarkable, works very well at what it does. The picture could be just a tad better but it's still quite good. The only other issue I have is with geofencing not working properly when I get close to home and sometimes I'll continue to trigger alerts when I arrive home. This seems to be an iPhone issue though as it happens with other apps. You really can't go wrong here, if you're on the fence about which camera to go with choose this one as it's Netgear a US brand and perhaps slightly less shady and more secure than these dirt cheap no name Chinese cameras popping up everywhere spying in your house (Creepy!).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: Good video and audio, tough to work w/ SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: I like the new camera (nice video and audio) and added it to SmartThings with my other gadgets. I like the sound and movement notification options and planned to use for home security. My critique is that not all functionality is seamless with SmartThings. For example, despite my best efforts, I can’t stop sound notifications when connected to SmartThings. I also cannot get video up quickly if at all through SmartThings. All else is good - video and audio come up fast through ARLO app.
customer_reviews.author: a10milli

customer_reviews.title: Overall very nice camera and features BUT the motion detection is just ridiculous.
customer_reviews.text: Overall very nice camera and features BUT the motion detection is really unreliable since it only uses video analysis and not true motion sensors. So, every time there is a sudden change of light, like a reflection from a car coming through the window in my case you will receive an alert. Which happens ALL THE TIME. The same if you have any lights in your house that turn on or off with a timer. And then you end up not paying attention to the alerts any more which pretty much defeats the whole purpose of the thing. Very bad design in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Erik P

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for indoor home use. I have tested it every day when I come home by walking in my home without disarming the camera. Without fail, the camera has caught me the second the door handle made a turning sound. I would give the product a perfect 5 if it had completely free icoud storage, but the free 7 day storage is the next best thing. I highly recommend this camera and the ARLO brand to anyone seeking an affordable, reliable, and quality picture/sound camera device.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Q Needs a Minor Fix
customer_reviews.text: Arlo Q is a fantastic camera with very clear, nice image and wide angle, and super night vision with IR. One drawback I just noticed is when at night the light turns on without motion then immediately motion occurs, eg. person walks under light, camera does not capture it for at least 3 to 4 seconds. That is frustrating given the overall success of the camera. I tried increasing sensitivity but of no help. This must be the time when IR turns off and should record immediately, but for some reason it does not and it does not capture the motion only at this particular time. Please look into it and hope you could find a fix asap.
customer_reviews.author: Lusak

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre, Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to monitor my downstairs. It's really frustrating because it's unreliable. I've had to restart and reconnect the device nearly five times. I have super fast internet and new wifi extenders/modems/routers - so there's no reason I should have any issues. I have a baby and am easily overwhelmed with tasks - I'm really upset I missed the return window. This was NOT worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: SCA

customer_reviews.title: Long 5 to 15 second delay in live feed
customer_reviews.text: There are many positive aspects to this camera but one major drawback is the large delay when viewing the live feed. The delay ranges from a minimum of 5 seconds up to 15 seconds or more. I believe this is because the live stream goes through Netgear's servers before it comes back to the client app. There really needs to be a mode that allows a direct streaming connection. I bought this as a baby monitor and is is pretty much useless for that because of this delay. If there is a firmware update to allow this then I will be back to update my review to 5 stars but without that 3 is all I can justify.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Baby Monitor (Yes, Baby Monitor)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for use as a baby monitor for our nursery. It costs about the same as other baby monitors with many more features (cloud storage, ability to view from multiple devices, etc.). I have been pleased with the performance as a baby monitor. The only knock I have is the sensitivity of the audio/motion detection. It catches most times my baby moves/cries, but sometimes it misses. Sometimes it's explainable (soft noise, subtle shifting), but other times it's unexplainable. Given it's primary use as a security camera, it'd be nice to have the option to increase/decrease the sensitivity of the audio/motion detection.
customer_reviews.author: AmberTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great Value-- free 7 day cloud clips
customer_reviews.text: Great Value., Especially the 7 days off found service for clips based on audio and/or visual changes. Easy setup-- had to set up twice to properly onnect to the internet. I used an iPhone Xs to connect. Alerts work well. My use case was to keep an eye on a condo renovation. Good range of view. I don't think there is enough night time resolution, particularly in evening when lights are off, to get detailed pictures for an arrest of a theoretical burglar. I think something on the order of 4K resolution is called for if you want collar a thief. SEtting up a weekly schedule was not too bad and that works well too to avoid false alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Marc G

customer_reviews.title: close, but it's getting sent back
customer_reviews.text: i was excited for this camera but i'm sending it back. why? • no local storage option (i was confused with the Arlo Q Plus, i bought the non-plus version). • i'm not paying monthly to record more than 15 seconds • yeah it only saves 15 seconds of the video online with the free plan. useless. the image looks good, the app seems decent and it was simple to set up. but if you don't want the camera uploads sapping all your bandwidth this camera is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: ~!~!~•/ G \\\°*'=

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware plagued by terrible cloud-based server and outdated software
customer_reviews.text: Great hardware, software rarely works, and when it does, it's way too delayed. Arlo seems to really be skimping on their network services. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: QwikF3

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Way too much delay all the time. The phone app isn't very intuitive. The app allows you to turn off the status light, but the camera never seems to get the message - I couldn't get the status light to turn off. With the really long delay, it renders the 2-way microphone useless. It doesn't really deserve 1 star, I can't think of one positive aspect about my user experience. I have a new netgear router with 100 mbps internet service. I think they severely underestimated their cloud storage needs to service this product line.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The 30 second clip recordings are a gimmick, because they didn’t always start when there actually was motion. Also, lens flare from headlights driving by would trigger them, but actual people walking around would take 20-30 seconds to start recording. The app is crazy slow. Takes forever to review footage. Then the advertisements to spend more money with them. Dear God... I’m already paying extra for the 24/7 recordings, why TF are you still bombarding me with emails and in app pop ups to spend more money!?!?
customer_reviews.author: Levity Events
